page.title: 06WILDLIFE
page.content:
{WILDLIFE}
Much of the wildlife of Bicker is disappearing fast due to the habitats being destroyed.
In 1984 the population of rabbits fell rapidly due to myxomatosis in this area.The dyke banks house an array of rodents,water voles and rats,shrews and wood/field mice.Their preditors are the fox, which is suffering because of the gasing carried out by farmers,the weasel and closely related stoat.
The hedgehog is one of the larger mammals that thrive in Bicker.Frogs, minnows,and sticklebacks are dying because of the chemical sprays being used.
